newsitem.title: UK: U.S. firms eyeing Northern Electric - paper.
newsitem.headline: U.S. firms eyeing Northern Electric - paper.

text.p: U.S. power firms Houston Industries Inc and Entergy Corp are the favourite candidates to launch rival bids for Northern Electric Plc, according to reports in Britain's Sunday newspapers.

The Independent on Sunday newspaper said Houston Industries is the favourite to emerge as a white knight for Northern, which is currently facing a 630p a share hostile bid from CalEnergy Co Inc's CE Electric UK unit.
Florida Power and Light and Pacific Gas and Electric are also being mentioned as potential U.S. bidders for the British regional electricity company, said the Independent.
The Independent also said that France's Lyonnaise des Eaux SA, which owns Northumbrian Water, could be interested in creating a northeastern water and electricty combination.
The Observer newspaper said that Entergy is believed to be considering a bid for Northern.
CE Electric launched a $1.225 billion bid for Northern on Monday, which was promptly rejected.
Northern Electric was not immediately available for comment.
